mapper.select: select b.no as no, b.title as title, b.contents as contents, b.hit as hit, b.reg_date as regDate, b.g_no as gno, b.o_no as ono, b.depth as depth, b.user_no as userNo, b.state as state,u.name as userName from board b, user u where b.user_no=u.no order by g_no desc, o_no asc

select b.no as no, b.title as title, b.contents as contents, b.hit as hit, b.reg_date as regDate, b.g_no as gno, b.o_no as ono, b.depth as depth, b.user_no as userNo, b.state as state,u.name as userName from board b, user u where b.user_no=u.no order by g_no desc, o_no asc limit #{startNo}, #{count}

select b.no as no, b.title as title, b.contents as contents, b.hit as hit, b.reg_date as regDate, b.g_no as gno, b.o_no as ono, b.depth as depth, b.user_no as userNo, b.state as state,u.name as userName from board b, user u, (select g_no as m_g_no from board where title like '%${keyword}%' and o_no=1) as m where b.user_no=u.no and b.g_no=m.m_g_no order by g_no desc, o_no asc limit #{startNo}, #{count}

select b.no as no, b.title as title, b.contents as contents, b.hit as hit, b.reg_date as regDate, b.g_no as gno, b.o_no as ono, b.depth as depth, b.user_no as userNo, b.state as state,u.name as userName from board b, user u where b.no=#{no} and b.user_no=u.no
